summary: This document is a CIA information report from October 8, 1963, providing a situation appraisal of South Vietnam as of October 5, 1963. It discusses coup plotting, demands by generals to President Diem, the atmosphere in Saigon, and potential surprises for the upcoming National Day celebrations. It also touches on the Viet Cong's lack of capitalizing on opportunities and potential GVN-DRV rapprochement.
title: CIA Information Report
recipient: JCS, SECDEF, NSA, NIC, CCI, STATE, INF, DIA, ARMY, ACSI, NAVY, AIR
